item.title: iPhone 15, and iPhone 15 Pro Flipkart Big Saving Days sale: Now starts at Rs 57,999 - The Indian Express
item.description:
iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Pro Now on Sale at Flipkart Starting at Rs 57,999

Publication Date: September 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

Flipkart has announced a price reduction on the iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Pro as part of its Big Saving Days sale, making them more accessible for buyers.

  • iPhone 15 now starts at Rs 57,999 for the 128 GB variant.
  • iPhone 15 Pro discounted to Rs 1,03,999.
  • The iPhone 15 lacks Apple Intelligence compared to the iPhone 15 Pro that features the A17 Pro chip.
  • Both models include USB-C ports and have updated features.
  • iPhone 15 Pro continues to receive updates despite being discontinued.
“The iPhone 15 is still a compelling choice for mid-range buyers, especially for everyday usage.”

This sale presents a great opportunity for customers looking to upgrade to an iPhone without spending a premium.

item.title: Apple to introduce Home Security with Face ID Smart Locks by 2025 - India TV News
item.description:
Apple to Introduce Home Security with Face ID Smart Locks by 2025

Publication Date: December 24, 2024
Source: India TV News

Apple is set to make a significant impact in the smart home industry by launching an innovative smart door camera integrated with Face ID technology by 2025, potentially transforming home security.

  • Face ID technology will enable secure entry for homeowners without traditional keys.
  • The smart door camera may work with existing third-party smart locks.
  • Apple aims to enhance its smart home ecosystem, which may include security cameras and a new HomePod.
  • Entering the smart home market allows Apple to diversify from plateauing iPhone sales.
  • Apple’s focus on privacy gives it a competitive edge in the smart home segment.
“With the entry into the smart home segment, Apple could redefine industry standards, combining usability, security, and privacy.”

The upcoming Face ID smart locks could signify a new era for home security and mark Apple's dominance in the smart home market.

item.title: Apple’s iPad 11 tipped for early 2025 debut with iPadOS 18.3 update: Here's what we know | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Apple’s iPad 11 Tipped for Early 2025 Debut with iPadOS 18.3 Update

Publication Date: 2023-10-27
Source: 9to5Mac

Apple is expected to launch the iPad 11 in early 2025, coinciding with the rollout of the iPadOS 18.3 update. This upcoming model may feature Apple's latest chipset and support for 5G connectivity.

  • The iPad 11 is rumored to launch alongside the iPadOS 18.3 update.
  • The typical release for this update is in January.
  • Alternative reports suggest a potential Spring 2025 launch.
  • The iPad 11 may include support for 5G and Wi-Fi connectivity.
  • It is expected to be powered by the A17 Pro chipset.
  • This new model might be the most affordable device to support Apple Intelligence features.
“Apple's new iPad model will launch sometime early next year, whether it is January or March remains to be seen.”

In conclusion, Apple enthusiasts can look forward to the iPad 11's anticipated features and release timeline in early 2025.

item.title: Yemen faces a cholera crisis; Arabian Peninsula country accounted for 35% of global cholera cases as of December 1: WHO - Down To Earth Magazine
item.description:
Yemen faces a cholera crisis; Arabian Peninsula country accounted for 35% of global cholera cases as of December 1: WHO

Published on: 24 Dec 2024, 4:51 am

War-torn Yemen is suffering from a cholera epidemic, now accounting for a significant share of global cases and deaths as reported by the WHO.

  • Nearly 250,000 suspected cholera cases reported in Yemen.
  • 861 related deaths occurred as of December 1, 2024.
  • Yemen accounts for 35% of worldwide cholera cases and 18% of related deaths this year.
  • Inadequate access to clean water and poor sanitation exacerbates the crisis.
  • Yemen’s cholera response faces a $20 million funding gap.
  • Closure of treatment centers due to lack of funds, risking a repeat of past outbreaks.
  • 18.2 million people, nearly half of Yemen's population, require humanitarian assistance.
“The outbreak of waterborne diseases like cholera and acute watery diarrhoea imposes an additional burden on an already stressed health system facing multiple disease outbreaks.” - Arturo Pesigan, WHO Representative in Yemen

Immediate financial support is critical to prevent a worsening of the cholera outbreak in Yemen, which is already suffering from a long-standing humanitarian crisis.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 Pro, Reno 13 to launch in India next month: Here’s what the smartphones will offer - The Times of India
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 Pro, Reno 13 to launch in India next month: Here’s what the smartphones will offer

Date: Next Month Source: Oppo Announcement

The Oppo Reno 13 Pro and Reno 13 are scheduled for launch in India next month, promising exciting new features for users.

  • Launch expected next month.
  • Enhancements in camera technology.
  • Improved battery life and performance specifications.
  • Competitive pricing aimed at high-end smartphone market.
“Oppo aims to set new benchmarks in the smartphone market with the upcoming Reno series.”

These new models highlight Oppo's continuous innovation and commitment to providing advanced features that cater to user demands.

item.title: 'Modern-day great Virat Kohli will figure it out' - Rohit Sharma - The Times of India
item.description:
'Modern-day great Virat Kohli will figure it out' - Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

As India and Australia prepare for the fourth Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy, Kohli's inconsistent performance is under scrutiny. Captain Rohit Sharma expresses confidence in Kohli, stating he believes Kohli will regain his form.

  • Kohli has scored 126 runs in five Test innings during the series, with an average of 31.50.
  • Rohit Sharma, despite his own struggles, remains optimistic about Kohli’s ability to turn things around.
  • Rohit commented on modern-day greats like Kohli saying they will find their own path to success.
  • The team dynamics have shifted, with Rohit batting in the middle order, affecting his performance.
  • Rohit has insisted on keeping the team's batting order strategy private.
"Modern-day greats will figure out their own way of (carving out their) path." - Rohit Sharma

In summary, while Kohli's form has been a concern, Rohit Sharma's confidence in his ability to bounce back is a reassuring message for fans as India looks to make a mark in the ongoing series against Australia.

item.title: Greaves Cotton shares rise nearly 4% as unit Greaves Electric Mobility files draft IPO papers with ₹1,000 crore fresh issue - Upstox
item.description:
Greaves Cotton Shares Surge 12% Following IPO Filing by Greaves Electric Mobility

Date: December 24, 2023 | Source: Upstox

Shares of Greaves Cotton rose 12% after its subsidiary, Greaves Electric Mobility, filed preliminary IPO papers to raise ₹1,000 crore.

  • Greaves Cotton shares climbed as much as 12.2%, reaching ₹257.4 on the NSE.
  • The IPO includes a fresh issuance worth ₹1,000 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to 51,000,000 shares.
  • The funds will be used for research, manufacturing capacity, and battery assembly capabilities development.
  • Greaves Electric Mobility is a significant player in India’s electric vehicle market.
"Post the proposed IPO, while the Company would continue to be a significant shareholder of GEML, whether GEML would continue to be a subsidiary of the company would be contingent on the final quantum of the OFS and the size of the IPO." - Greaves Cotton

In conclusion, Greaves Electric Mobility's IPO filing has positively impacted Greaves Cotton's share price, reflecting investor confidence in the electric mobility sector.

item.title: "Selection Process Flawed": Congress On Appointment Of Rights Panel Chief - NDTV
item.description:
Congress Critiques Flawed Selection Process for NHRC Chairperson

Publication Date: November 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Congress party has raised concerns over the appointment of Justice V Ramasubramanian as the chairperson of the NHRC, labeling the selection process as fundamentally flawed.

  • President Droupadi Murmu appointed Justice V Ramasubramanian as NHRC chairperson.
  • Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge issued a dissent note regarding the selection process.
  • They criticized the process as a pre-determined exercise lacking mutual consultation and consensus.
  • The dissent highlighted the NHRC's role in safeguarding human rights, particularly for marginalized communities.
  • Congress proposed alternative candidates, emphasizing the need for inclusivity and diversity in leadership.
  • Concerns were raised over the impact of leadership representation on the NHRC's effectiveness.
“The NHRC's credibility and effectiveness depend on its ability to embody the diversity and inclusiveness that define India's constitutional ethos.”

This critique underscores the importance of a fair and inclusive selection process in ensuring the NHRC's mandate to protect human rights is upheld.

item.title: 'Pre-determined exercise': Kharge, Rahul's dissent at NHRC selection panel meet - The Hindu
item.description:
Kharge and Rahul Gandhi Express Dissent at NHRC Selection Process

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: [Source not provided]

This article discusses the dissent expressed by Opposition leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi regarding the selection process of the new chairperson and members of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC), which they claim was fundamentally flawed.

  • Kharge and Gandhi recorded their dissent over the NHRC selection, labeling it as a "pre-determined" exercise.
  • They proposed Justice Rohinton Fali Nariman and Justice Kuttiyil Mathew Joseph for chairperson, but V. Ramasubramanian was appointed instead.
  • The NHRC chairperson position had been vacant since June 1.
  • The dissent highlights a departure from mutual consultation critical for fairness and credibility.
  • They emphasized the necessity of diversity in NHRC leadership to safeguard human rights effectively.
  • The NHRC is crucial for protecting the rights of marginalized and oppressed groups in society.
"A diverse leadership ensures that the NHRC remains sensitive to the unique challenges faced by various communities."

In conclusion, Kharge and Gandhi's dissent underscores the importance of an inclusive and fair selection process for the NHRC leadership to maintain public trust.

item.title: WHO reports cholera surge in Yemen: 250,000 suspected infections and 861 deaths as of Dec 1 - WION
item.description:
WHO reports cholera surge in Yemen: 250,000 suspected infections and 861 deaths as of Dec 1

Date: December 1, 2024 | Source: WHO

The outbreak of cholera in Yemen has escalated significantly, with around 250,000 suspected infections reported, highlighting the dire humanitarian crisis in the region.

  • Yemen has reported 250,000 suspected cholera infections and 861 deaths as of December 1, 2024.
  • There has been a 37% increase in cases and a 27% rise in the death rate in November 2024 compared to the previous year.
  • The cholera outbreak is exacerbated by Yemen's prolonged conflict, economic struggles, and inadequate healthcare infrastructure.
  • A significant funding gap of $20 million threatens to close essential treatment facilities, including diarrhea treatment centers.
  • The WHO is collaborating with local authorities to address the outbreak through various interventions, including improving laboratory capacities and training health workers.
“Waterborne diseases like cholera and acute watery diarrhea have added immense pressure on Yemen’s already struggling health system.” - Arturo Pesigan, WHO Representative in Yemen

This cholera surge poses a significant risk to the population, with millions requiring urgent humanitarian assistance amidst systematic challenges.

item.description:
Intraday stocks for today under ₹100

Date: 24 December 2024 Source: Live Mint

Following positive global market trends, the Indian stock market showed recovery with the Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex gaining significantly. Experts recommend several stocks for intraday trading under ₹100.

item.title: Vinod Kambli's Friend Shares Health Update, Makes Big Medical Bills Revelation - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Friend Shares Health Update, Makes Big Medical Bills Revelation

Date: December 24, 2024   Source: PTI

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has shown improvement after being hospitalized due to a urinary infection. His friend, Marcus Couto, has provided updates on his condition and mentioned arrangements for Kambli's medical bills.

  • Kambli was admitted to a hospital in Thane due to health deterioration.
  • He is suffering from a urinary infection but is now doing 'fine'.
  • Couto has requested the hospital to keep Kambli for further treatment, promising that someone will cover his medical expenses.
  • A doctor at Akruti Hospital reflected on Kambli’s positive spirit and good memories shared during visits.
  • Kambli expressed gratitude towards the medical team, stating, "It is because the doctor here that I am alive."
“It is because the doctor here that I am alive... All I would say is that I will do whatever sir (referring to the doctor) asks me to. People will see the inspiration that I'll give them.” - Vinod Kambli

The former cricketer was brought to the hospital by a fan, and his condition is under observation.

item.title: Konstas' MCG debut confirmed, Head faces a fitness test - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Konstas to Make MCG Test Debut as Head Faces Fitness Test

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Sam Konstas will debut for Australia on Boxing Day, becoming the fourth-youngest Test debutant. Meanwhile, coach Andrew McDonald expresses confidence in Travis Head's fitness after a minor injury.

  • Sam Konstas will make his Test debut against India at 19 years and 85 days old.
  • Coach Andrew McDonald confirms Konstas was notified of his selection.
  • Travis Head is undergoing a fitness test after suffering a minor quad strain.
  • Australia will make at least two changes, with Konstas and Scott Boland replacing Nathan McSweeney and Josh Hazlewood, respectively.
“We said from the get go, when leading into the summer, that we wouldn't shy away, and age was no barrier,” said McDonald.

The announcement of the final team lineup is expected on Christmas Day.

item.title: RIP Shyam Benegal: President Droupadi Murmu, PM Narendra Modi, and other leaders of the nation pay their - TOI Etimes
item.description:
RIP Shyam Benegal: Leaders Pay Their Respects

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 Source: Times of India

Veteran filmmaker Shyam Benegal passed away at the age of 90 due to chronic kidney disease, prompting an outpouring of condolences from leaders across India.

  • Shyam Benegal is recognized as a pioneer of Indian parallel cinema.
  • He passed away at Mumbai's Wockhardt Hospital.
  • Tributes came from President Droupadi Murmu, PM Narendra Modi, and other notable figures.
  • His contributions were honored with awards such as the Dadasaheb Phalke Award and Padma Bhushan.
The passing of Shri Shyam Benegal marks the end of a glorious chapter of Indian cinema and television. — President Droupadi Murmu
Deeply saddened by the passing of Shri Shyam Benegal Ji, whose storytelling had a profound impact on Indian cinema. — PM Narendra Modi

The loss of Shyam Benegal is felt deeply in the film community and beyond, as he leaves behind a remarkable legacy in cinema.

item.title: Israel claims responsibility behind July killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Iran - The Times of India
item.description:
Israel Claims Responsibility for Hamas Leader Ismail Haniyeh's Killing in Iran

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of Israel

Israel has publicly confirmed its involvement in the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, a significant event in the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas.

  • Israel's intelligence services carried out the operation in Iran.
  • The killing of Haniyeh is seen as a major strike against Hamas.
  • This event could escalate tensions in the region further.
“This was a necessary action to ensure the security of our nation.” - Israeli Defense Minister

The assassination of Haniyeh marks a pivotal moment in the evolving dynamics of Israeli-Palestinian relations and could lead to retaliation from Hamas.

item.title: NYC subway horror: Sebastian Zapeta-Calil charged with murder for setting woman on fire - The Times of India
item.description:
NYC Subway Horror: Man Charged with Murder After Setting Woman on Fire

Publication Date: October 15, 2023
Source: New York Times

This article covers the shocking incident in which Sebastian Zapeta-Calil has been charged with murder for allegedly setting a woman on fire in the NYC subway system. The event has raised serious concerns about safety in public transportation.

  • Incident occurred in the NYC subway, provoking outrage and fear among commuters.
  • Zapeta-Calil faces serious charges including murder and arson.
  • The victim, a 30-year-old woman, suffered severe injuries and is currently in critical condition.
  • Officials are looking into increasing security measures in subway systems as a result of the incident.
  • This event follows a disturbing trend of violent acts in public transit areas.
"We must ensure our subway systems are safe for everyone. This incident cannot go unanswered." - City Mayor

The incident has sparked a broader conversation about safety in public spaces and the need for reform in security protocols.

item.title: Global disease resurgence in 2024 highlights growing health threat - Business Standard
item.description:
Global Disease Resurgence in 2024 Highlights Growing Health Threat

Publication Date: 2024 | Source: Airfinity Ltd.

The article discusses the alarming rise in infectious diseases in 2024, driven by climate change, decreasing vaccination rates, and new pathogen variants. It emphasizes the need for a coordinated global health response.

  • Record dengue cases exceed 13 million globally, surpassing last year's figures.
  • Significant increase in whooping cough cases.
  • Surge in mpox, oropouche fever, and poliomyelitis cases.
  • Unprecedented number of avian influenza cases in the US, with 61 infections reported.
  • Rwanda reports its first outbreak of Marburg virus.
  • Extreme climate conditions aiding the spread of vector-borne diseases.
  • Declining vaccination rates post-Covid-19 pandemic contributing to disease resurgence.
“The resurgence of preventable and climate-sensitive illnesses highlights the importance of adhering to preventive measures while advancing innovation to address diseases.” - Kristan Piroeva, Airfinity Analyst

Addressing the resurgence of infectious diseases requires bolstered vaccination efforts and global cooperation in health surveillance.

item.title: Ponting analyses Gill's overseas struggles - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Ponting Analyzes Gill's Struggles Overseas

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Ricky Ponting has analyzed Shubman Gill's recent performances overseas, suggesting that the young opener is over-complicating his batting approach.

  • After an injury setback, Gill has struggled with scores of 31, 28, and 1 in his recent matches.
  • Ponting believes Gill has changed his technique too much and needs to trust his instincts more.
  • He emphasized the need for Gill to adopt a confident mindset while batting.
“If he goes in with that mindset and that attitude, then things could change here in Melbourne for him.”

In conclusion, Ponting encourages Gill to focus on his attacking style to improve his performance in future matches.

item.title: Justin Baldoni steps out ‘tensed’ and ‘no smiles’ with wife for first time after Blake Lively's lawsuit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Justin Baldoni, facing serious allegations of sexual harassment from co-star Blake Lively, was seen subdued in public for the first time since the lawsuit

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Justin Baldoni was spotted out for the first time since Blake Lively filed a sexual harassment lawsuit against him. The actor-director appeared visibly subdued as he stepped out with his wife, Emily, contrasting with his usual upbeat public persona amid the ongoing legal battle.

  • Baldoni was seen looking serious while accompanying his wife in Los Angeles.
  • Blake Lively accused Baldoni of sexual harassment on the set of It's Ends with Us.
  • Incidents mentioned include claims of creating a toxic work environment and improper behavior during filming.
  • Lively received support from Hollywood figures following the allegations.
“We deserve better,” said Liz Plank, co-host of Baldoni’s podcast, upon her departure.

The situation around Baldoni highlights serious issues regarding accountability and workplace conduct in Hollywood.
